Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Typically, it starts with creating a purchase requisition, then approving it, issuing a purchase order, receiving goods, processing the invoice, matching it to the PO, releasing payment, and then closing the case. So, that's the usual flow.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Looking at Case 1001 first. The activities are: Create Requisition, Approve, Issue PO, Receive Goods, Vendor Invoice Received, Match Invoice, Release Payment, Close. That seems in order.

Name: Pattern Recognition - NE
Text: Moving on to Case 1002. The activities are: Create Requisition, Issue PO, Vendor Invoice Received, Release Payment, Approve Requisition, Receive Goods, Match Invoice, Close. Wait, that doesn't seem right. In the standard process, you don't issue a PO before approving the requisition.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Here, they created the requisition, then immediately issued the PO without approval. That's a problem because approving the requisition should come before issuing the PO. Without approval, issuing the PO might be unauthorized.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Also, after issuing the PO, they received the vendor invoice and released payment before approving the requisition. That's a big issue because releasing payment without proper approvals can lead to unauthorized spending or fraud.

Name: Validation - NE
Text: Moreover, they received the invoice before getting the goods, which is a bit odd because usually, goods are received before the invoice is processed.

Name: Pattern Recognition - NE
Text: Next, looking at Case 1003. The activities are: Create Requisition, Approve, Issue PO, Release Payment, Vendor Invoice Received, Receive Goods, Match Invoice, Close. Hmm, the order here is a bit off.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: After issuing the PO, they released payment immediately. Usually, you don't release payment right after issuing the PO without receiving the goods and processing the invoice. Releasing payment too early could lead to issues if the goods aren't received or if there's an invoice discrepancy.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Also, they received the vendor invoice after releasing payment, which is not the standard flow. Normally, you process the invoice after receiving the goods and before releasing payment.

Name: Validation - NE
Text: In this case, they also received goods after releasing payment, which is the reverse of the standard process. You should receive goods first, then process the invoice, and then release payment.

Name: Pattern Recognition - NE
Text: Lastly, Case 1004: Create Requisition, Approve, Receive Goods, Issue PO, Vendor Invoice Received, Match Invoice, Release Payment, Close. Here, they received goods before issuing the PO.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: That's unusual because you should issue the PO first, then receive the goods. Issuing the PO after receiving goods could mean that the purchase wasn't properly authorized beforehand.

Name: Validation - NE
Text: Additionally, they issued the PO after receiving goods, which breaks the sequence. The standard flow requires the PO to be issued before goods are received to ensure that the purchase was authorized.
